1.verse: Salutation. -Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved friend and fellow worker,

2.verse: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the Church that meets in your house:

3.verse: grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Thanksgiving and Prayer. -I always give thanks to my God when I remember you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of the love and faith that you have for the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.

6.verse: I pray that the sharing of your faith may become even more effective so that you may come to perceive all the blessings we have in Christ.

7.verse: Your love has given me much joy and encouragement because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you, my brother.

8.verse: Plea for Onesimus. -Therefore, although I am confident that in Christ I have the right to command you to do your duty,

9.verse: I would rather appeal to you on the basis of love. I, Paul, an old man, and now also a prisoner for Christ Jesus,

10.verse: am appealing to you on behalf of my child, Onesimus, whom I have fathered during my imprisonment.

11.verse: He was formerly useless to you, but now he is indeed useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: Therefore, I am sending him back to you, that is, I am sending my very own heart.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me so that he might be of service to me on your behalf during my imprisonment for the gospel,

14.verse: but I did not want to do anything without your knowledge, so that your good deed might be voluntary and not compelled.

15.verse: Perhaps this is the reason he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but as more than a slave: as a brother. He is beloved especially to me, but even more so to you, both as a man and in the Lord.

17.verse: Therefore, if you consider me to be a friend, welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will repay it. I say nothing about the fact that you owe me your very self.

20.verse: Yes, my brother, grant me some benefit in the Lord. Set my heart at rest in Christ.

21.verse: Conclusion. -I have written to you confident of your acceptance, and in fact I am certain that you will do even more than I ask.

22.verse: At the same time, please prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping through your prayers to be restored to you.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings,

24.verse: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
